Fields.DialogueText: Look out there, Captain. Do you see those clouds brewing?
Did you really expect me to miss those? Looks like it'll be one hell of a storm.
I hope it causes more trouble for the Morganas than it will for us.

Fields.MenuText: I like to believe that nobody is immune to nature's wrath.
Probably not. They're actual monsters. I doubt they'll notice.
I'm not really sure what to expect when it comes to Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: Morganas are unnatural. Perhaps they actually could be immune...
You're right. It's more likely that the storm is afraid of the Morganas.
Well, if you ask me, I think a good hurricane or two should sink even a Morgana.
Morganas certainly are fearsome opponents. We still don't have any surefire tactics for facing them.
If it was up to me, we'd be running straight into the fight, Captain!
A bold move. Suits you.
I hope that's a compliment.
It might be. Don't get a big head though.
It always works for me. Face your problems head on and never back down!
Well, this time our problem is a storm? What do you suggest we do?
Face it! And any dangers within! We should move forward without fear!
You're getting riled up again. I need to keep an eye on you.
@BATTLE
It looks like we're almost out of the storm!
And into the oven. I'm picking up some Morganas just ahead of us.
Of course. There's always more. Get ready for battle!
@BATTLE
That's wasn't too bad, right? It was actually kind of great. I've never felt so alive!
That attitude of yours is going to get us in some serious trouble one day.
But not today! Today we won!

Fields.MenuText: I guess you're right. We did beat those Morganas.
Barely. I was this close to losing an eye!
We won't always.

Fields.DialogueText: And there is no prize more valuable than that, right?!
What, seriously?! You know, now that I'm looking at you, I think you could make an eyepatch work for you.
We will. I promise. We'll always find a way to win.
At least we're safe now. I can finally catch my breath.
You're welcome for that.
I'll admit, I'd be dead many times over without you. Thank you, Rawalpindi.
Oh, don't get all mushy on me, Captain. It's nothing.
Well, in that case I won't mention it again. Let's get out of here before the storm decides to chase us.
Wait, I mean it was a little something. You can feel free to thank me every now and then. I don't hate it.
Captain, we've got Morganas in the distance on our port side.
Are they approaching? Why isn't the alarm sounding?
Because they're not moving. They're just sitting there watching us.
Hmmm... Could they be waiting for a chance to strike? Inspecting our tactics? Setting up an ambush?
Could be all the above - but it won't matter if we rush in and take them out now!
I thought I was still the Captain.
I'm just making a suggestion. Obviously you're giving the final order. So give it already.

Fields.MenuText: We wait them out.
We strike hard.
We call for help.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? I guess I should get ready to sit on my hands for a while.
That's my captain! They won't know what hit 'em.
You really think we need reinforcements? I can handle them!
*BOOM*
Sounds like you're not the only one itching for a fight. The Morganas are making a move.
See? No one likes just sitting around. It's always more satisfying to rush in.
Let's hope it's more satisfying for us and less so for them.
@BATTLE
More Morganas on approach, Captain.
Let's put a stop to them then.
@BATTLE
Phew. That was quite the pickle.
A pickle? I've actually never had one.
You don't know what a pickle is? That's almost a crime.
I know what a pickle is, I've just never eaten one. Is it really that important?

Fields.MenuText: They're one of the fundamental food groups.
Well, I think tasting everything is important. How else do you know what you really like?
Very. You need to taste them to know how disgusting they really are.

Fields.DialogueText: The "pickle" food group? Oh, now I'm certain that isn't true.
Well, I doubt I'll enjoy it more than chicken karahi, but I can give it a shot.
They're disgusting? Then why would I ever want to eat one?!
I'm not going to force you to eat anything you don't want to, but all this talk of food is making me really hungry.
Then let's grab something to eat. I might even try a pickle, if you try some chicken karahi.
Chicken Karahi? How do you know I haven't already had it? Maybe it's my favorite dish.
Well, if it isn't already, it's about to be.
You're reading "The Influence of Sea Power upon History" again?
I don't think I'll stop until I run out of room to take notes in the margins.
You're a note taker, huh? Mind if I take a look?
Sure, here you go. There are a lot to choose from. Oh, I hope you can read my handwriting!
This note says, "Naval warfare revolved around technology each side possessed."
I remember that one. Basically, the side with the better technology had the advantage. So everyone was always trying to make technological advances.
And here you are with guns from the Great War.
Really? Sheesh, I must have forgotten...

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry if I upset you.
You still manage to do a great job with them.
Sarcasm is not a good color on you.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not upset. We've gone over this. I'm fine with what I have.
It's actually more of a team effort. I may fire them, but you tell me where to shoot.
Oh, I'm so sorry, I'll never be sarcastic again! That was sarcasm, in case you didn't pick up on it.
So my guns are old, big deal! It just means the odds are stacked against me a little. I like being the underdog.
I don't think you're the underdog. Anyone who bets against you is a fool.
Heh, you know what, you're right! I'll overcome any challenge this war throws at me. Stick with me, and maybe you will too.
Why do you think I'm still here?
I just thought you were trying to get yourself killed. You don't have a deathwish?
*ALARM*
Not yet, but it seems like the Morganas do.
Then let's put them down!
@BATTLE
Captain, we've got Morganas.
They're not wasting any time.
@BATTLE
The Morganas just won't leave us alone lately.
Maybe they just figured out how amazing I am and they want to be my new best friends.

Fields.MenuText: Making friends with Morganas? I can't think of a worse influence.
Well, you are pretty great. I wouldn't blame 'em.
You're looking for a new best friend? What about me?

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, you've got that right... Wait, did you mean me or them?
Oh, look at you with the flattery. The Morganas aren't the only ones who want to be my best friend, huh?
You just assumed you were my best friend? That's a little presumptuous, Captain. You have to earn a title like that.
You don't really think the Morganas could make good friends, do you?
Of course not. Why do you think I keep blasting them full of holes?
Yeah, artillery fire between friends isn't really a thing.
Not unless you're really, really good friends.
*ALARM*
*BOOM*
Rawalpindi, did you hear that blast? I need a status report.
Um... one of our engines may have taken a hit.
How bad of a hit?
It could be worse! We're not sinking. From what I can tell, repairs shouldn't take long.
I don't want to stop for repairs in the middle of the open ocean. We should consider making a port call.
Preferably before Morganas come sniffing our way? That might be wise... and I'm sorry about this, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: No need to apologize. We'd have been dead in the water long ago if you weren't so tough.
Let's focus on fixing it.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I mean... I am doing all I can to keep everything running.
Of course. This is my top priority, and I won't let anything distract me.
All right, you keep working on the engine, I need to go check on the injured.
That's another thing I should apologize for.
What are you talking about?
I should be a little more cautious in battle. Less risk would mean taking fewer hits... and fewer injured.
War has inherent risk. Besides, that sort of behavior wouldn't exactly be you, now would it?
You're right... I'll get back to work. Go check on the injured.
I didn't mean it as a bad thing.
Captain? We're about to have a problem!
Nothing we can't handle.
@BATTLE
There you are, Rawalpindi. I've been looking all over the ship for you. We need to review tactics, and I can't do that without you.
Maybe you should.
That doesn't sound like you. If you're not there who's going to suggest we charge straight at the enemy?
Maybe it's best if no one suggests that.
What's going on, Rawalpindi?
I messed up, Captain. I'm thinking I need to start changing some things about myself.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I guess personal growth and change is healthy.
Don't you dare change a thing, Rawalpindi. Not a thing.
Like your clothes? I don't think there's anything wrong with your uniform.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, that's what I keep telling myself.
Not a thing? Captain, I didn't realize you were such a fan.
No, not my clothes! I'm talking about changing my personality.
If this is about before, you shouldn't go changing who you are because of one setback.
If it had been another Belle in that fight, would they have gotten as damaged? How many people would've been injured on their watch?
You're not another Belle, you're you. And you shouldn't try to be someone else.
Come on, we need to discuss tactics, and I can't think of anything better to get your mind off all this.
All right... but only because you're making me.
*ALARM*
More Morganas on approach, Captain.
Let's put a stop to them.
@BATTLE
Rawalpindi? You're in bed? Back in bed or still in bed?
Both, maybe. I'm just really tired. I need a few more hours of rest.
And what should I tell the Morganas if they come knocking while you're napping?
That I'll kill them later.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, sleep tight. Hope we don't die without you.
Take all the time you need. I hope you feel better, Rawalpindi.
Maybe I'll just hop in bed, too. It does look pretty comfy.

Fields.DialogueText: You sure know how to lay on the guilt.
How can you be so nice to me? I'm literally lying down on the job!
Don't even think about it. This is my bed. Go get your own.
Whatever you're thinking right now, just know that we would definitely not be better without you.
*ALARM*
Urrrrrrgggggh!
Looks like your wake up alarm is sounding.
I'm getting up.
You sure you're up for it?
You couldn't fight without me, right?
Exactly.
@BATTLE
So it's been some time. How're you feeling now? Still want to curl up in bed and hide from the world?
You're making it sound far worse than it was. I came out to fight the Morganas, didn't I?
You almost didn't though. Come on, I just want to know what's been troubling you.
I just have days sometimes, you know? I wonder if maybe I wouldn't have been better off as a merchant vessel.
Didn't we just recently spend a good amount of time keeping you on the front lines?
Most of the time, I am confident that I belong here. I know that I'm making a difference. And then there are other times... when I make mistakes...

Fields.MenuText: That's crazy, Rawalpindi. Everybody makes mistakes.
So then do you really not want to be here anymore?
If that's how you feel, then maybe the front lines really aren't for you.

Fields.DialogueText: Ordinary people's mistakes don't endanger lives. We can't afford any mistakes, Captain.
Yes? No? I don't know. It's complicated, Captain.
I know what you're trying to do. You're trying to use reverse psychology on me. And it's working.
I want to keep fighting with you, I do. I just... I want to be sure that I'm not... more trouble than I'm worth.
Rawalpindi, as much trouble as you are sometimes, I wouldn't want to be fighting this war without you.
Thank you. I think I needed that.
Anytime. Now stop moping around! We've got Morganas to destroy.
Heh, yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
Rawalpindi, it looks like we've been assigned a new mission.
It's about time. I was getting a little bored with our patrol.
Up for something new? Glad to see you're in a better mood.
Sometimes all you need is a reason to get up in the morning. Something like an important mission, maybe. So what are we doing?
Well, it seems like Morganas have set up a little blockade, attacking civilian and merchant ships when they get close. We're to put an end to them.
Destroy some Morganas? Easy!
I wouldn't be so sure. Judging by the reports I've received, this could be harder than it sounds.
Oh really? What could be so dangerous about this blockade specifically?

Fields.MenuText: There's a whole lot of them. And they're fast.
You know what? You're right. We should be able to handle this no problem.
Strategically, they've got a great position. We'll be fighting an uphill battle here.

Fields.DialogueText: That just means there's more for me to litter the water with.
Thank you! That's what I like to hear from my captain.
So they have a teeny tiny advantage? When has that ever stopped me before?
Didn't you want to start focusing a little more on strategy, Rawalpindi?
Oh, right! Working on it...
You've got a little time to figure it out before we reach the blockade.
I've got a plan; let's hurry! The longer we take to destroy them, the more innocent lives are lost!
Let's go.
@BATTLE
Goodness! I don't think I've ever been so hungry.
Eat up! you'll need all the energy you can get for the upcoming battle.
I piled as much as I could fit on this plate. Care to try some? It's chicken karahi. Your tastebuds will thank you.

Fields.MenuText: No thanks. I'm not one for spicy food.
Sure, I guess I'll try a bite.
If it's that good, I'm surprised you'd want to share with me.

Fields.DialogueText: What are you, a baby? One bite isn't going to kill you.
There you go. I knew you'd recognize a quality meal when you smelled it.
Me, too. Take a bite before I change my mind.
That's actually not bad.
Not bad? You meant to say wonderful... and just imagine how good it would be if it was actually made in India. There's nothing like authentic chicken karahi.
Maybe we'll have to make port there after we handle this assignment.
Seriously? Don't say something like that and not mean it, Captain.
I said maybe. It depends on how quickly we destroy this blockade.
@BATTLE
I hear you loud and clear, Captain. That blockade will be dust in no time!
So, we know the Morganas are positioned along this line here. We should be able to flank them and catch them unawares if we move around this cover.
We could just coax them into the open ocean and really go to town on them.
Maybe, but their ships are smaller and faster than ours. Open ocean would give them more of an advantage than it would us.
You're right. We'd be surrounded before we knew it. I really need to focus more on strategy so I don't make a costly blunder.
You have any ideas you've read about in that book of yours?
Right! Let me just reread really quickly. You can bounce some of your ideas off me while I'm looking this up.

Fields.MenuText: Well, what if we just use one really big blast to create a tsunami and sink them?
We should just focus fire on their engines and put them down fast.
What if we attack when it's dark? Night could give us the element of surprise.

Fields.DialogueText: That's not how that works. You went to school, right?
Usually that's a good tactic, but you said these Morganas were small and fast. They might be able to out maneuver us.
I'm not positive, but I'm pretty sure Morganas have better night vision than we do.
Well, that was my best idea. What do you have?
I, uh... Oh, here it is!
What'd you find?
Something we could use to defeat these Morganas. They shouldn't see it coming.
@BATTLE
So this is your plan, Rawalpindi? False flags?
It's a little more than that. I've got the entire crew working on making me look like a merchant vessel again.
I think the hardest thing to hide will probably be the guns. Maybe we can cover them with crates... and when the Morganas get close we'll shoot through them. Perfect!
The Morganas have been destroying civilian ships, so your idea is to make yourself look like one?
And when they come close, expecting easy prey, we rip them to shreds. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: It's ingenious.
Sounds overly complicated.
We don't have to tear off any of our armor or anything, right?

Fields.DialogueText: I know, right? As I am sure you know, engagements have been won with deception throughout history.
Well, we could just rush in blasting. That's what I'd usually do, but that didn't end very well last time.
No, we're painting over it as best we can. It won't last forever, but we only need to fool them long enough to get close.
You know this is a little crazy, but if it works, I'll be really impressed.
Correction, you are already impressed.
We're on our approach. You're sure everything is ready?
Guns are hidden, hull is painted, flags are false. I think we're good.
More importantly, what do you think? Would you believe we're a merchant ship?

Fields.MenuText: Everything looks old, crappy, and like we're trying to make money. I think it's perfect.
I think the paint could use a little work. Looks like you got a third-grader to do it.
I wouldn't be fooled by any of this. Let's just hope the Morganas will be.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you. I remember what being a merchant felt like. This is about as accurate as I could get it.
I wouldn't say that around the crew. They worked really hard to make it look good.
I don't think Morganas are fools, but they shouldn't see something like this coming.
It's time to start our approach.
Fantastic. Everyone, get in your places.
What is everyone wearing? Did you put the crew in costumes?
Not costumes, just out of uniform. We wouldn't exactly pass as merchants otherwise.
I refuse to believe that officer wears that ridiculous hat when he's off duty.
That's what merchants wear! They like to show off how much money they make!
*BOOM*
A warning shot.
The Morganas are approaching. They think we're scared little merchants.
Let's prove otherwise.
@BATTLE
That's all of them. I don't think they'll be setting up any more blockades here any time soon.
Fantastic job, Rawalpindi.
Oh, stop. Any Belle could've done this.
No. You're wrong, Rawalpindi. No one else could've done this. It had to be you.
What do you mean?
You dress up a warship, paint it whatever color you like, it's still obvious it's a warship. The only reason this worked is because you---
Because I'm not a warship.
Exactly, and that's a good thing.
I guess in this case, it really was.
So now, I think you deserve a little reward.
Wait! There's something wrong. The Morganas... I think they're coming back!

Fields.MenuText: The same ones? That's impossible.
I guess they didn't get enough of a beating!
We still need to recover. Can we avoid them?

Fields.DialogueText: They might be different ones, but how likely does that really seem?
That's the attitude I like to see from my captain. We'll beat them again!
I don't think so. They're coming in fast.
How close are they?
They're still a ways out. What are your orders?
Prepare for a fight. If we lose here they can just set up their blockade again. We need to force them out for good.
That's what I was hoping you'd say.
@BATTLE
All right... That's the last of them... again.
You're sure they're not coming back?
No. Maybe we should just wait a minute before we catch our breath.
How could these Morganas survive either of those battles?
You know how I fight. They should've been scrap.
Could they have retreated and recovered that quickly? Unless they had reinforcements waiting. The dirty rats.
Fitting name. Morganas and rats have a lot in common. No matter how many times you think you're rid of them, they reappear.
How do you know so much about rats?
As a merchant vessel, I have transported food. On one occasion, I had a bit of a rat infestation. It took far too long to eradicate them completely.

Fields.MenuText: How'd you finally get rid of them?
If Morganas were the size of rats, this war would be a lot easier to finish.
You'd tell me if you still had rats, right?

Fields.DialogueText: A deckhand was getting into the food and leaving it open, and the rats were following the smell onto the ship. We had to get rid of the deckhand to solve the problem.
Yet we still deal with rats to this day, despite them being disease ridden creatures. More likely we'd just ignore the Morganas if they were smaller.
Yes, I'd tell you. And then we'd work together to find a way to completely destroy them. Together.
If only we knew as much about Morganas as we do about rats.
We know we can't afford to let them win. That's enough for now.
And today, because of us, they haven't.
There's always going to be tomorrow though, isn't there?
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
It seems like our mission is complete.
No. We can't call this a victory yet.
What are you talking about? We won the battle.
They're just going to come back as soon as we leave. I can feel it.
Then what would you suggest we do then?
We treat them like the rats they are. We chase them, find their hiding place and snap their necks with a trap.

Fields.MenuText: We're not in the best shape for another battle of that size.
Vicious and tactical. I like it.
You do realize these are Morganas we're talking about, not rats.

Fields.DialogueText: We can make port on the way if we must, but we have to give chase. If we turn away now, they'll just come back.
I've been working on my strategy. I'm glad you like it.
The same principles apply.
If you really think this is the right course of action, then I trust you, Rawalpindi.
I knew you would. Come on, let's go. We've already given them enough of a head start.
@BATTLE
We've got another pack of Morganas on approach!
You know what we have to do then.
Finish them fast.
@BATTLE
Dammit! How could we have lost them! They're a giant group of Morganas! They can't be so stealthy.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe Morganas can turn invisible? Maybe they're here right now!?
We should've chased after them sooner.
We'll find them. Don't give up.

Fields.DialogueText: Morganas can't turn invisible... probably. Even if they could, I'd still be able to sense them nearby. I think...
You're right about that. But it's not too late yet. We can't give up!
I know that! I'm not giving up, I'm just angry!
Let's take a breath and collect our thoughts.
Okay... Let's think... They were a massive fleeing group of Morganas...
And they were injured so they couldn't have gotten that far.
Right... so it must to be a pretty well-hidden spot. They wouldn't want just anyone happening upon them.
So we're looking for a hidden spot nearby that could hold all of those Morganas. There can't be that many of those nearby.
In fact... There are only a few places that could work. I think I know where we're going!
So they're in there, huh?
A hidden away cove, just large enough to hold all the Morganas that make up that blockade. And the reinforcements that came after them.
That's a big cove.
It's probably a tight fit. We won't be able to take a shot in there and not hit a Morgana.
Wait, you're not actually suggesting we go straight into that nest, are you?
Maybe. Do you have a better plan?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, a couple dozen of them. And none of them are suicidal.
No, but I can recognize a bad plan when I see one.
Ask me again in a minute.

Fields.DialogueText: You should know me well enough to know I'm not suicidal.
A bad plan is better than no plan at all.
We don't have a minute. Those Morganas could start storming out of there any moment!
You could have a little more faith in me, Captain.
I'll trust you. If you think the right move is to go straight into the Morgana nest, then we go.
Thank you, Captain, but are you crazy? I don't have a death wish.
What? But you just said---
We must give them a taste of their own medicine.
@BATTLE
Wait here for just a bit longer and I can explain. Besides, we need to take care of some strays first...
So we're just sitting out here?
And waiting for them to come out. We're blockading the blockade. Genius, right?
Silly me. I mistook all of this waiting around for just waiting around.
Think about it! If we keep them trapped in there, they can only come out a few at a time, limiting the number we have to fight at once.

Fields.MenuText: Surprisingly smart, Rawalpindi.
What if we get attacked from behind while we're fending them off?
Sounds good in theory, but we don't know how the Morganas will react. They might try to burst out of the cove all at once.

Fields.DialogueText: See, I can be strategic! It's not as fun... but I can do it!
With that kind of attitude, you can poke a hole in any plan.
If too many try to force their way out at once, I'm hoping their hideout might collapse on them.
As long as we don't let them overpower us, we should be fine.
You say that like it's going to be easy.
Nothing with Morganas ever is, but we better get ready for it. I'm sensing activity...
*BOOM*
Oh, you don't say?!
@BATTLE
This is actually working!
Of course it is!
And stop sounding so surprised...

Fields.MenuText: Honestly, I thought we might die here. I think we still might.
I'm not surprised, I'm just happy! Happy to be alive!
I knew you had it in you!

Fields.DialogueText: But it's working! You said so yourself.
You're smiling in the middle of battle? I think I might be rubbing off on you.
I don't read that book all the time for nothing!
At this rate, we should be done with these Morganas in no time.
*ALARM*
Is that the alarm? We already know Morganas are nearby! Turn that thing off!
Another group has moved in! We have additional Morganas approaching from astern.
Great, just what this battle needed...
We can still make this work if we take them out quickly.
If anyone can make this work, it's you. Let's go!
@BATTLE
I think this is the last of them! We're almost there, Rawalpindi.
About time these pathetic excuses for monsters decide to lay down and DIE already!
COME ON! Let's show them the meaning of FEAR! We are their DOOM!
Battle cries are getting pretty loud... Is it bad that this is normal to me now?
@BATTLE
No more? Is that really it? I feel like... there should be more...
Catch your breath, Rawalpindi. It's done. They're finished.
Really? That's... a shame. I could keep... fighting for days.

Fields.MenuText: Really? You look like you're ready to collapse.
I can see that. You're a one-woman army.
Stop fighting it and pass out already. Some rest might be good for you.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't collapse. I'm not a collapser.
Damn straight! I'm a warship! Don't let anyone tell you otherwise.
I'll pass out when I feel like it! And I think I might feel like it soon...
You did good work, Rawalpindi, go rest a bit while we get to port.
Wait... do you really think we finished them all off? For good this time?
After what I saw? I wouldn't be surprised if all the Morganas have run back to where they came from with their tails between their legs.
Heh, yeah, I was pretty awesome.
Hey, you awake? And decent?
Yes, on both counts. Please come on in, Captain.
How are you feeling?
There's still a dull ringing in my ears, but otherwise, I think I'm ready for the next battle.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you are, but I'm sure as hell not!
I figured you wouldn't stay down for long. Not even after a mission like that.
You sure? You showed some signs of fatigue.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, don't be such a baby. We've had worse fights. And we'll have a dozen more before this war is over.
You know it! Nothing can keep me down. Not even a hundred Morganas.
Don't make me prove you wrong! I'll go out and find a Morgana to fight right now.
Glad you're feeling better. You should know we're getting close to port.
Thanks. I'll admit that's good to hear.
Oh, and... thanks for letting me take the lead there.
What do you mean?
You were ready to call the mission a success and head to port. I'm the one that made us hunt them down. Plus, when we found them, you followed my strategy.
I'm glad I have your trust, Captain.
It was nothing. What else are friends for?
Heh, yeah. Right. You know if there's ever anything you need from me, you can ask away.
Well, in that case, we'll be making port in India. I'm hoping you might know a good place to pick up some of that really authentic chicken karahi.
Seriously? I know all the places! Get ready for the best meal you've ever had!
@BATTLE
But first things first. Looks like somebody wants to spoil our appetites.
Fools! They should know that getting in my way only makes me fight harder!
Close your eyes. Let the taste spread through your mouth and down your throat.
Taste can't spread down your throat.
Not with that attitude. Eat.

Fields.MenuText: Holy! That's... Did you just stick a torch in my mouth?!
Hmmm... You know, that is rather pleasant. It's got a nice tingle to it.
I thought you said this was spicy. I wouldn't even call this mild.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, I knew you wouldn't be able to take it. Don't worry, I got something a little more mild too.
See, I knew you'd love it! Don't worry about eating too much, I made sure we got extra.
What?! You're crazy! This is so spicy that you shouldn't even be able to talk!
I can definitely taste what you meant. This is what authentic chicken karahi should taste like!
I'm glad you understand. Now here, take your fork and eat up!
